channel.title: Adding objects, help please?
channel.description: I've seen it be done before but I don't really know how to do it myself...So could someone please if they can tell me how to remove or place objects such as shelves, fences, or signs of that sort to be placed on the map...thanks if you can help me :)

item.title: Adding objects, help please?
item.dc:creator: @Imnotokkk Imnotokkk
item.description:
@Imnotokkk wrote:

To add an object is quite simple, I am a huge noob and I can do it. Go into Client.java press ctrl + f and type in
"makeglobalobject and you should see a big list of things that look like this:

           makeGlobalObject(3056, 3689, 2304,-4, 10);//Spikes clanwars
           makeGlobalObject(3040, 3652, 2304,-3, 10);//Spikes for entrace of cwars
           makeGlobalObject(3038, 3652, 2304,-3, 10);//Spikes for entrace of cwars
           makeGlobalObject(3039, 3652, 2304,-1, 10);//spikes for cwars
           makeGlobalObject(3037, 3652, 2304,-3, 10);//Spikes for entrace of cwars
           makeGlobalObject(3038, 3656, 1531,-4, 10);//door for clanwars
           makeGlobalObject(3035, 3652, 2304,-3, 10);//Spikes for entrace of cwars
           makeGlobalObject(3034, 3652, 2304,-3, 10);//Spikes for entrace of cwars
       makeGlobalObject(3306, 3204, 2783, 0, 10);//anvil
       makeGlobalObject(3084, 3490, 4877, 0, 10);//general stall
       makeGlobalObject(3084, 3488, 2562, 0, 10);//gem stall
       makeGlobalObject(3084, 3492, 4878, 0, 10);//scimitar stall
       makeGlobalObject(3085, 3499, 4876, 0, 10);//magic stall
       makeGlobalObject(3084, 3494, 2565, -3, 10);//silver stall
       makeGlobalObject(3084, 3496, 2560, -3, 10);//silk stall
       makeGlobalObject(3096, 3500, 6552, 0, 10);//magic altar
       makeGlobalObject(2768, 2756, 362, -3, 10);//barrel
           makeGlobalObject(3565, 3095, 3496, 0, 10);//portal
           makeGlobalObject(3303, 3123, 2472, 0, 10);//portal
           makeGlobalObject(2901, 3557, 2213, 0, 10);//bank

Then what you do is copy this : makeglobalobject(xcoord, ycoord, itemID, 0, 10);//itemname

delete the xcoord ycoord itemID and itemname and fill in with the proper numbers.

Read full topic
